edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings

All Implemented Interfaces:
com.davidsoergel.dsutils.GenericFactoryAware, com.davidsoergel.dsutils.Labellable<String>, com.davidsoergel.stats.DiscreteDistribution1D, com.davidsoergel.stats.IntArrayContainer, com.davidsoergel.stats.MutableDistribution, edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.AdditiveClusterable<T>, edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.Clusterable<T>, SequenceSpectrum<T>, Cloneable
public abstract class IntKcount<T extends IntKcount>
extends Kcount<T>
implements com.davidsoergel.stats.IntArrayContainer

Represents the counts of a set of given patterns appearing in a string. Typically the patterns counted are simply all subsequences up to a length K. How the symbols are interpreted and counted is up to the implementation and the associated KcountScanner, so it's easy for instance to make optimized scanners for certain kinds of sequences, or to use compressed alphabets, and so forth.

Kcounts may be related through a "parent" link. The interpretation depends on the implementation, but a typical usage would be for the "parent" Kcount to contain less-specific information, i.e. fewer counts of more general patterns, perhaps generated by aggregating the specific counts from the child.

("Parent" may not be the best name for this... perhaps "generalized" or some such?)

Version:
$Id: IntKcount.java 442 2009-06-15 17:53:56Z soergel $

David Soergel

Method Detail

clone

public abstract T clone()
Clone this object. Should behave like Object.clone() except that it returns an appropriate type and so requires no cast. Also, we insist that is method be implemented in inheriting classes, so it does not throw CloneNotSupportedException.

Specified by:
clone in interface SequenceSpectrum<T extends IntKcount>
Specified by:
clone in class HierarchicalSpectrum<T extends IntKcount>
Returns:
a clone of this instance.

equalValue

public boolean equalValue(T other)
Test whether the given pattern counts are equal to those stored here. Differs from equals() in that implementations of this interface may contain additional state which make them not strictly equal; here we're only interested in whether they're equal as far as this interface is concerned.

Specified by:
equalValue in interface edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.Clusterable<T extends IntKcount>
Parameters:
other - The Kcount to compare against
Returns:
True if they are equivalent, false otherwise

getArray

public int[] getArray()
Returns an array of the counts. The mapping of patterns to array indices is implementation-dependent. A typical implementation will order all possible patterns up to length K in lexical order according to the symbol alphabet.

Specified by:
getArray in interface com.davidsoergel.stats.IntArrayContainer
Returns:
The array of counts

spectrumEquals

public boolean spectrumEquals(SequenceSpectrum spectrum)
Test whether the given sequence statistics are equivalent to this one. Differs from equals() in that implementations of this interface may contain additional state which make them not strictly equal; here we're only interested in whether they're equal as far as this interface is concerned. Equivalent to equalValue(IntKcount) in this case.

Specified by:
spectrumEquals in interface SequenceSpectrum<T extends IntKcount>
Parameters:
spectrum - the SequenceSpectrum
Returns:
the boolean
